org.usfirst.frc.team1736.lib.BatteryParam

Class BatteryParamEstimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team1736.lib.BatteryParam.BatteryParamEstimator

  • public class BatteryParamEstimator
extends java.lang.Object
    DESCRIPTION:
    Battery parameter estimator - calculates an estimate for a battery's open circuit voltage (Voc) and equivilant series resistance (ESR) based on a windows of system current/voltage measurements. Ensures enough spread in the measurement window to ensure confidence in the estimate. Based on a whitepaper detailing an algorithm developed for the 2016 FRC season by FRC1736 RobotCasserole.
    The constants for the initial parameter estimate were tuned assuming a freshly charged, relatively new MK ES17-12 battery (from andymark). It should self-adjust to whatever battery you put in. However, if you seen a giant jump at the start of each match, you may wish to update the "*init" constants to more accurately represent your "nominal" initial system state.

    Whitepaper link: Current Estimation.

    USAGE:
    1. Instantiate Class
    2. Once per periodic loop, call the updateEstimate() method to calculate a new paramater estimate
    3. After updateEstimate(), call the other getters to utilize the estimated parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BatteryParamEstimator

        public BatteryParamEstimator(int length)
        Initalizes all internal variables for using the class.
        Parameters:
        length - Window size to consider for estimation. 100 is usually a good start. Smaller windows make the estimator react faster to rapid changes in the electrical system, but larger windows make it more immune to noise. Engineering tradeoff, you pick!

    • Method Detail

      • setConfidenceThresh

        public void setConfidenceThresh(double Thresh_A)

      • updateEstimate

        public void updateEstimate(double measSysVoltage_V,
                           double measSysCurrent_A)
        Update the internal estimates with a new measured system voltage and current. Should be called once per control loop.
        Parameters:
        measSysVoltage_V - Battery voltage as measured by PDB
        measSysCurrent_A - Current draw as measured by PDB

      • getEstESR

        public double getEstESR()
        Getter for ESR. Must be called after estimator is run.
        Returns:
        the most recent calculated equivalent series resistance

      • getEstVoc

        public double getEstVoc()
        Getter for Voc. Must be called after estimator is run.
        Returns:
        the most recent calculated open circuit voltage

      • getConfidence

        public boolean getConfidence()
        Getter for Confidence condition met boolean. Must be called after estimator is run.
        Returns:
        True if the most recent window had enough spread in I_draw for a reasonable estimate, false if not.

      • getEstVsys

        public double getEstVsys(double Idraw_A)
        Given a system current draw, estimate the resulting system voltage given the latest estimated battery parameters.
        Parameters:
        Idraw_A - estimated system current draw in Amps
        Returns:
        Estimated Vsys in Volts

      • getMaxIdraw

        public double getMaxIdraw(double VsysMin_V)
        Given a minimum system voltage allowable, estimate the maximum current which may be drawn from the battery at the present time.
        Parameters:
        VsysMin_V - minimum desirable system voltage
        Returns:
        The maximum current which the robot may pull in amps.
